page.title: 08FARMING IN STUBHAMPTON AREA
page.content: The area under cultivation has been increasing for some years, and is still increasing as copses are cleared and downland ploughed. The principal crops are wheat and barley, with some turnips, sweetcorn and kale. Organic farming occurs in only one location where woodland is being replaced by organic wheat, to provide the long straw needed for thatching. The cattle grazed on the grassland are predominantly Friesian dairy cows with their calves, but there is one herd of Guernseys. There is also a beef herd of cross-bred Charolais. Sheep were once very numerous on the downland, but then largely disappeared. Recently, however, they have returned to some extent. Many of the ewes are cross-breeds noted for producing a large number of lambs with a good growth rate.
